passages.text: Australia | Metals & Mining South32
FY25 - Kicking The Caginton Down The Road

Underlying EBITDA was in line with VAE, NPAT/EPS/final div missed expectations. FY26 shows higher operating costs across most operations, with production broadly pre- guided and capex broadly in line. Cannington has been adjusted lower ahead of its final \(\sim 6\) - year operations, with expansion options being assessed. The streamlining of S32's portfolio continues toward base metals, with Hermosa remaining the core long- term valuation anchor. Reiterate HOLD, PT AUD2.90/150.00p.

FY25 Results - In line. Underlying EBITDA of \(\) 1,928\(m was in line with VAE (Figure 2); adjustments included a\) \ \(346m\) impairment at Mozal, \(\) 118m\(divestment of Cerro Matoso, and\) \ \(122m\) JV adjustments. Final dividend of 2.6cps was in line and represented \(40\%\) of FY25 underlying earnings of \(\) 666m\(. Net cash benefited from a\) \ \(225m\) working capital unwind in 2H25. \(\) 144m\(of the\) \ \(200m\) buyback remains outstanding extended to 11- Sep- 26.

FY26 production guidance unchanged. Guidance was mostly unchanged, Mozal production was reset at 240kt and is expected to go into C&M by Mar- 26 (Here). Cannington's mine plan has been reset to manage underground complexity: ore processed averages \(\sim 1.8\) Mtpa over FY26- 31, with FY26 payable Zn- eq of 200.6kt on lower volumes and revised processing rates. Sierra Gorda FY26 Cu- eq guidance is 85.7kt, lifting to 90.2kt in FY27 on grade. Worsley holds FY26 at 3,750kt alumina, with a path back toward nameplate from FY27 as new bauxite areas come on. Australia Manganese normalises to 3.2Mwt; South Africa Manganese sits at 2.0Mwt subject to continued trucking. FY26 unit cost guides step- up across several assets, with mgm flaging FX, energy, and consumables as drivers, partly offset by reduced contractor/ maintenance spend and embedded savings programs. FY26 Group capex including EAls is guided to \(\) 1.4\(bn, about\) \ \(100m\) lower than May guidance after reprioritisation. Hermosa growth capex lifts to \(\) 750m\(as shafts and surface infrastructure accelerate.

Cannington reset lower, but likely more reliable. The new plan acknowledges sustained geotechnical complexity. Mining rates are lowered, processing rates revised, and cost base optimisation is in train to align contractors and equipment with lower volumes. The reserve currently supports about \(\) 1\(years at the reduced run rate. S32 is also studying an open- pit option to unlock the\) \ \(2\) 1t Resource and capture higher silver prices. The FY26 production mix leans to lead/silverZn 40kt; Pb 87kt; Ag 8.2Moz), and unit costs rise to \(\) 205/t\(while savings are embedded+\) \frac{1}{2}\$

Other operational updates. Worsley secured environmental approvals for new bauxite areas and is positioned to climb back toward nameplate from FY27, aligning with improved bauxite quality and lowered maintenance intensity. Sierra Gorda's fourth grinding line feasibility is due H1 FY26. GEMCO normalises after cyclone impacts; South Africa Manganese remains constrained by logistics but steady. Brazil Aluminium ramps all three potlines in FY26, partially offsetting Mozal's wind down.

Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 6 - 11 of this report. \\* Jefferies (Australia) Pty Ltd \\* Jefferies LLC / Jefferies Research Services, LLC

Source: Company Reports, FactSet, Jefferies
Figure 2 - S32 Comparative Full Year Results
Source: Company Reports, FactSet, Visible Alpha, Jefferies
Figure 3 - S32 Forecast Changes
Investment Thesis / Where We Differ
The company's management team has built a portfolio of growth options via exploration and M&A. Valuation is currently compelling, in our view.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
Base Case, AUD2.9, - 0%
- The Chinese economy gradually recovers from the current downturn.- Copper and aluminium prices rise over the next five years.
Upside Scenario, AUD3.8, +31%
- Chinese demand for commodities exceeds our expectations, and commodity prices average 15% higher than we are forecasting.- South32 beats consensus expectations and its own operational guidance.
Downside Scenario, AUD1.8, - 38%
- Chinese demand for commodities falls short of our expectations, and commodity prices average 15% lower than we are forecasting.

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Management of the Regulatory Environment - Regulatory challenges in gaining approval for developing mine sites resulting in longer lead times as a result of the environmental impact of operations and increasing geopolitical tensions.

Company Targets: 1) Senior Leadership Team target of 40% women. 2) Established a target for operations in baseline water stress to achieve at least a 10 per cent improvement in water use efficiency by FY27.

Questions to Management: 1) How do you identify required decarbonization expenditures? 2) Total Recordable Injury Frequency decreased by 12% last year, how can you make sure this hits your 20% annual target going forward? 3) How do you ensure responsible water usage at sites that you have identified as having water stress?
- Strength in LMEX prices would be positive for S32;- Cost-cutting would be positive;- M&A is a risk.

Figure 4 - South32 - Operational Summary
Source: Company Reports, Jefferies

South32 Limited is an Australia- based, UK- listed diversified commodities producer with exposure to bauxite, alumina, aluminium, manganese, coal, nickel, silver, lead, and zinc. The company has operating assets in Australia, South Africa, Mozambique, Brazil, and Colombia.
Our price target is NPV- based. Key risks to the upside and downside are commodity prices and M&A risk.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated
securities with an average security price consistently below \(10, the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus 20% or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, P/E growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise PicksJefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
